Detail of Activity / Test - Culverts to be placed in line with existing culvert

Detail of Activity / Test - Excavtion of Trench should be within tolerances.
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - For each site where Culvert is Required is required

2.03 - Pipe bedding and haunch zone inspection
Detail of Activity / Test - Bedding Material
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - 1 per trench length
Acceptance Criteria - The Engineer shall complete a Visual Inspection to NZTA F/3: 2010 each strength length on Pipe bedding and haunch zone
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Checksheet
2.04 - Pipe bedding and haunch zone Density Testing
Detail of Activity / Test - Pipe surround material shall be placed and compacted over the full width of the trench to a finished minimum thickness of 150mm above the crown of the pipes.
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - 1 per 15m trench length Minimum of 2 tests between pits/manholes
Inspection / Test method - NDM / Clegg Report
Acceptance Criteria - The pipe bedding and haunching zone shall be compacted to a MDD of 90%
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Checksheet

Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - Test Each Pipe as it placed

Acceptance Criteria - Placed to correct line and level as per IFC Drawings
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Surevy Records
Detail of Activity / Test - Pipe surround material shall be placed and compacted over the full width of the trench to a finished minimum thickness of 150mm above the crown of the pipes.
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - 1 per backfill layer per 15m trench length. Minimum of 2 tests backfill layer per trench between pits/manholes
Inspection / Test method - NDM / Clegg Report
Acceptance Criteria - The Side zones shall be compacted to a MDD of 90%
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - NDM/Clegg Report
Detail of Activity / Test - Only hand operated compaction tools shall be used until the backfill has achieved a depth of 300mm above the crown of the pipe.
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - During Works
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Checksheet
Detail of Activity / Test - The Engineer shall complete a Visual Inspection to NZTA F/3: 2010 each strength length on Pipe overlay zone
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - 1 per trench length (Between Chambers)
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Engineers Record
Detail of Activity / Test - Backfill material shall be built up in layers not exceeding 200mm. The Pipe overlay zone shall be compacted to a MDD of 90%
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - 1 per 15m trench length Minimum of 2 tests between pits/manholes
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - NDM/Clegg Report
